eu.toolchain.concurrent

Class DirectCaller

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.toolchain.concurrent.DirectCaller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Caller
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrintStreamCaller

    public abstract class DirectCaller
extends Object
implements Caller
    An abstract implementation of a caller that invokes the handles directly in the calling thread.

      • referenceLeaked

        public void referenceLeaked(Object reference,
                            StackTraceElement[] stack)
        Description copied from interface: Caller
        Indicate that a Managed reference has been leaked.

        This is usually called by end-user code that never releases a managed reference, like this: 

        
 public static class Example {
   private final Async async;
   private final Managed<Database> database;

   public Example(final Async async, final Managed<Database> database) {
     this.async = async;
     this.database = database;
   }

   public Stage<Void> doSomething() {
     return database.doto(database -> {
       Completable<Void> stage = async.future();
       return stage;
     });
   }
 }

        This leaves the managed database in an open state since its reference count will never go back to zero. When the future and the corresponding borrowed is garbage collected, it will be reported here.

        Specified by:
        referenceLeaked in interface Caller
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference that was leaked
        stack - the stacktrace for where it was leaked, can be null if the information is unavailable

      • internalError

        protected abstract void internalError(String what,
                                      Throwable e)
